Class Ballot

java.lang.Object
Ballot
public class Ballot extends Object
Class representing a single voter's ballot. It is responsible for interpreting the ranking of candidates as given by a voter.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Ballot()
    Default constructor initializing an empty ballot with a ranking digit starting at 0.
    Ballot(ArrayList<Candidate> formattedBallot)
    Overloaded constructor that takes a preformatted ballot.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ballot

      public Ballot()
      Default constructor initializing an empty ballot with a ranking digit starting at 0.

    • Ballot

      public Ballot(ArrayList<Candidate> formattedBallot)
      Overloaded constructor that takes a preformatted ballot.
      Parameters:
      formattedBallot - An ArrayList of Candidate objects in the order of voter's preference.

  • Method Details

    • translateBallot

      public ArrayList<Candidate> translateBallot(String input, int candidateCount, List<Candidate> allCandidates)
      Translates a comma-separated string of rankings into an ordered list of Candidate objects.
      Parameters:
      input - A string representing the voter's ranked choices.
      candidateCount - The total number of candidates in the election.
      allCandidates - A list of all candidates in the election.
      Returns:
      An ordered ArrayList of Candidate objects based on the voter's preferences.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if a non-integer ranking is found within the input string.

    • incrementRankingDigit

      public void incrementRankingDigit()
      Increments the ballot ranking digit.

    • getInputtedBallot

      public String getInputtedBallot()
      Gets the raw input ballot string.
      Returns:
      The raw input string representing the voter's choices.

    • setInputtedBallot

      public void setInputtedBallot(String inputtedBallot)
      Sets the raw input ballot string.
      Parameters:
      inputtedBallot - The raw input string representing the voter's choices.

    • getFormattedBallot

      public ArrayList<Candidate> getFormattedBallot()
      Gets the formatted list of candidates based on voter's preference.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Candidate objects in the order of preference.

    • setFormattedBallot

      public void setFormattedBallot(ArrayList<Candidate> formattedBallot)
      Sets the formatted list of candidates based on voter's preference.
      Parameters:
      formattedBallot - An ArrayList of Candidate objects in the order of preference.

    • getBallotRankingDigit

      public int getBallotRankingDigit()
      Gets the current ranking digit being processed.
      Returns:
      The ballot ranking digit.

    • setBallotRankingDigit

      public void setBallotRankingDigit(int ballotRankingDigit)
      Sets the current ranking digit.
      Parameters:
      ballotRankingDigit - The digit representing the current ranking being processed.

    • getNextCandidate

      public Candidate getNextCandidate()
      Retrieves the next candidate in the ranking order, if available.
      Returns:
      The next Candidate object in the order, or null if there are no more candidates or the next candidate is not in the election.
